studentTips.text: I've noticed the bulletin board gets updated with new things to do every day!
I feel like joining clubs is a really good way to learn new skills-- I've found so many ways to spend my time through hobbies I've picked up from clubs!
When I keep my living space clean and tidy I feel like it is so much easier to focus.
Establishing even small daily habits goes a long way to helping you stay motivated in other areas of your life
I like keeping a water bottle with me throughout the day-- staying hydrated seems to help me focus
I like to check my email every morning-- one time I didn't and I didn't realize class had been cancelled until I got to the classroom! :(
I have a calendar where I keep track of when all my assignments are due.
I've found myself putting every activity I want to do in a reminder app on my phone, it's sometimes easy to forget everything that's going on around campus without the reminders!
The career center has really helpful advice about resumes and future job prospects!
I like to check in with my friends and see how they're doing and so they don't forget I exist :)
Me and my roommate get along so well! It's nice taking time to do activites with her outside the dorm room, such as getting coffee together or going to the gym
If you haven't heard from a friend in awhile, it could be fun to invite them to do something with you around campus! (like get food, or study perhaps?)
I like making friends in classes and at least being on friendly terms with the person I'm sitting next to. Study buddies are nice to have!
If you're at a social event or have some downtime, striking up a conversation with someone who doesn't seem busy can be a good way to make a new friend!
I had an internship last summer. They offered me a full time job for when I graduate!
I would totally recommend applying to as many internships as you can find online-- if you get one in your field it looks great on your professional resume!
Whenever I go back to my room I always put my key in the same place where I'll remember where it is-- I kept losing it in my room otherwise!
My laptop is really low on battery... I should've brought my charger with me.
I like sitting in the academic longue during gaps between classes to work on my homework.
I have a flashcard app on my phone which makes studying quite convenient when I don't have anything else to do.
It's always nice going to office hours and chatting with my professors, especially when I'm feeling a little overwhelmed or unsure of where to start with homework.
